pages.text: Therizinosaurus was a large theropod dinosaur that lived during the Late Cretaceous Period (70-66 million years ago) in what is now Mongolia. It was characterized by its massive 2.5-3 meter long forelimbs ending in three enormous claws, which could reach up to 1 meter in length. Unlike what was previously thought, Therizinosaurus was likely herbivorous, using its elongated claws to pull down branches and strip vegetation. The creature stood approximately 6 meters tall and could reach lengths of 9-10 meters. While no complete skeleton has been found, fossil evidence suggests it was covered in primitive feathers like other therizinosaurs. Its unusual features, including a small head, long neck, wide pelvis, and leaf-shaped teeth, made it highly distinct among theropod dinosaurs.
Cardi B's nail tech would be proud of those claws fr fr
